paper_title.ja: X-ray differential phase-contrast imaging using Schlieren knife-edge and diffuser plate
paper_title.en: X-ray differential phase-contrast imaging using Schlieren knife-edge and diffuser plate

description.ja: Illuminating a sample with parallel x-rays and scanning a knife-edge at the back focal plane of an objective zone plate, a relatively quantitative differential phase image can be obtained. If a light source having a broadened focal point at the back focal plane is used, the same effect can be obtained without scanning the knife-edge. In this study, we confirmed this with an optical system in which a diffuser was introduced into the illumination system, and applied it to phase tomography using the schlieren edge.
description.en: Illuminating a sample with parallel x-rays and scanning a knife-edge at the back focal plane of an objective zone plate, a relatively quantitative differential phase image can be obtained. If a light source having a broadened focal point at the back focal plane is used, the same effect can be obtained without scanning the knife-edge. In this study, we confirmed this with an optical system in which a diffuser was introduced into the illumination system, and applied it to phase tomography using the schlieren edge.

paper_title.en: Design and Fabrication of Wolter-type 4-mirror system

description.en: A Wolter-type 4-mirror system was designed and evaluated by ray-trace calculation. The design and fabrication process were developed. The master mandrel of oxygen-free copper was shaped by diamond turning. The Pyrex glass replica was made by a vacuum replication technique. A visible light image of a metal mesh could be obtained using this replica mirror.

paper_title.en: Observation of Phase Objects by Using an X-ray Microscope with a Foucault Knife-Edge
paper_title.ja: Observation of Phase Objects by Using an X-ray Microscope with a Foucault Knife-Edge

description.en: An x-ray microscope with a zone plate was assembled at the synchrotron radiation source of BL3C, Photon Factory. A Foucault knife-edge was set at the back focal plate of the objective zone plate and phase retrieval was tested by scanning the knife-edge. A preliminary result shows that scanning the knife-edge during exposure was effective for phase retrieval. Phase-contrast tomography was investigated using differential projection images calculated from two Schlieren images with the oppositely oriented knife-edges. Fairly good reconstruction images of polystyrene beads and spores could be obtained.

paper_title.en: Time-lapse observation of electrolysis of copper sulfate with a full-field X-ray fluorescence imaging microscope

description.en: The time-lapse observation of the electrodeposition of copper in copper sulfate solution was performed by imaging X-ray fluorescence from the copper deposition. The X-ray fluorescence was directly imaged with a full-field Wolter mirror microscope, which was constructed at the Photon Factory. Controlling the electric current in the solution from 0 to 71.7 mu A, the deposition of copper on a Pt cathode was directly observed by imaging its X-ray fluorescence. One exposure time for obtaining an X-ray fluorescence image was 80s. Then, it was 17 min later from the beginning of the electrolysis when the Xray fluorescence image of the electrodeposition is observed for the first time. At this exposure time, the detection limit of the mass of copper was estimated to be 0.60pg/image, which was calculated using test samples of 1.00 x 10(-3)-1.00 mol/l copper sulfate solutions.

paper_title.ja: Time-Lapse Observation of Electrolysis of Copper Sulfate with a Full-Field X-ray Fluorescence Imaging Microscope
paper_title.en: Time-Lapse Observation of Electrolysis of Copper Sulfate with a Full-Field X-ray Fluorescence Imaging Microscope

description.ja: The time-lapse observation of the electrodeposition of copper in copper sulfate solution was performed by imaging X-ray fluorescence from the copper deposition. The X-ray fluorescence was directly imaged with a full-field Wolter mirror microscope, which was constructed at the Photon Factory. Controlling the electric current in the solution from 0 to 71.7 μA, the deposition of copper on a Pt cathode was directly observed by imaging its X-ray fluorescence. One exposure time for obtaining an X-ray fluorescence image was 80 s. Then, it was 17 min later from the beginning of the electrolysis when the X-ray fluorescence image of the electrodeposition is observed for the first time. At this exposure time, the detection limit of the mass of copper was estimated to be 0.60 pg/image, which was calculated using test samples of $1.00\times 10^{-3}$–1.00 mol/l copper sulfate solutions.

The X-ray fluorescence was directly imaged with a full-field Wolter mirror microscope, which was constructed at the Photon Factory. Controlling the electric current in the solution from 0 to 71.7 μA, the deposition of copper on a Pt cathode was directly observed by imaging its X-ray fluorescence. Then, it was 17 min later from the beginning of the electrolysis when the X-ray fluorescence image of the electrodeposition is observed for the first time. At this exposure time, the detection limit of the mass of copper was estimated to be 0.60 pg/image, which was calculated using test samples of $1.00\times 10^{-3}$–1.00 mol/l copper sulfate solutions.

paper_title.en: Application of a charge-coupled device photon-counting technique to three-dimensional element analysis of a plant seed (alfalfa) using a full-field x-ray fluorescence imaging microscope

description.en: A full-field x-ray fluorescence imaging microscope using a Wolter mirror was constructed at Photon Factory BL3C2. White x rays from a bending magnet were used to excite x-ray fluorescence and to enhance the x-ray fluorescence intensity. A photon-counting method using a charge-coupled device was applied to obtain an x-ray fluorescence spectrum at the image plane. The spatial distributions of some specific atoms such as Fe and Zn were obtained from photon-counting calculations. An energy resolution of 220 eV at the Fe K alpha line was obtained from the x-ray fluorescence spectrum by the photon-counting method. The newly developed three-dimensional element mappings of the specific atoms were accomplished by the photon-counting method and a reconstruction technique using computed tomography. (c) 2007 American Institute of Physics.

paper_title.en: Application of a Zernike-type phase contrast hard X-ray microscope to microtomography

description.en: A Zernike-type phase contrast hard X-ray microscope was constructed at Photon Factory (PF) BL3C2. The spatial resolution of better than 200 nm was obtained with the zone plate of the outermost zone width of 50 nm at the X-ray energy of 5 keV. A pinhole-type phase plate was made of 3 mu m thick aluminum foil. Transparent biological specimens could be observed. A phase contrast three dimensional image was obtained using a tomographic technique.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF X-RAY SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY

paper_title.en: Observation of a Soft Tissue by a Zernike Phase Contrast Hard X-ray Microscope
paper_title.ja: Observation of a Soft Tissue by a Zernike Phase Contrast Hard X-ray Microscope

description.en: A Zernike-type phase contrast hard X-ray microscope was constructed at the Photon Factory BL3C2 (KEK). A white beam from a bending magnet was monochromatized by a silicon double crystal monochromator. Monochromatic parallel X-ray beam illuminated a sample, and transmitted and diffracted X-ray beams were imaged by a Fresnel zone plate (FZP) which had the outer zone width of 100 mu. A phase plate made of a thin aluminum foil with a pinhole was set at the back focal plane of the FZP. The phase plate modulated the diffraction beam from the FZP, whereas a direct beam passed through the pinhole. The resolution of the microscope was measured by observing a tantalum test pattern at an Xray energy of 9 keV. A 100nm line-and-space pattern could be resolved. X-ray montage pictures of growing eggs of artemia (plankton) were obtained.

paper_title.en: Production of reflection point sources for hard X-ray Gabor holography

description.en: The production of point X-ray sources for hard X-rays of approximately 8 keV is proposed and their application to Gabor holography is examined. Small X-ray sources less than 100 nm in diameter are obtained by total reflection from a limited surface area at grazing incidence. A microstrip plated with heavy metal on a glass plate is used for a one-dimensional small Xray source and crossed glass rods for a two-dimensional X-ray source. A virtual source width smaller than approximately 80 nm is demonstrated. Young's X-ray interference fringes are obtained using beams reflected from two microstrips. Gabor Xray holograms of a gold wire and a diatom are recorded with a virtual point source and their reconstructed images are numerically obtained..

publication_name.en: JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS BRIEF COMMUNICATIONS & REVIEW PAPERS

paper_title.en: Production of reflection point sources for hard X-ray Gabor holography

description.en: The production of point X-ray sources for hard X-rays of approximately 8 keV is proposed and their application to Gabor holography is examined. Small X-ray sources less than 100 nm in diameter are obtained by total reflection from a limited surface area at grazing incidence. A microstrip plated with heavy metal on a glass plate is used for a one-dimensional small Xray source and crossed glass rods for a two-dimensional X-ray source. A virtual source width smaller than approximately 80 nm is demonstrated. Young's X-ray interference fringes are obtained using beams reflected from two microstrips. Gabor Xray holograms of a gold wire and a diatom are recorded with a virtual point source and their reconstructed images are numerically obtained..

paper_title.en: Combined Imaging System for X-ray Fluorescence and Transmission X-ray Microtomography
paper_title.ja: Combined Imaging System for X-ray Fluorescence and Transmission X-ray Microtomography

description.en: A full-field imaging x-ray fluorescence computed microtomography system was designed for quantitative elemental analysis. An x-ray fluorescence imaging microscope combined with transmission x-ray microtomographic system was constructed at BL3C2 of the Photon Factory, KEK, Japan. The quasi-monochromatic beam produced by a double-multilayer monochromator was used as an incident beam. X-ray fluorescence images were obtained and were reconstructed by simultaneous algebraic reconstruction technique (SART) with taking into account of the self-absorption effects of the incident beam and the x-ray fluorescence of the sample. Distribution of Fe in a standard sample (1.60 mol/l FeCl2 solution in a capillary tube) was observed to evaluate the system. The density of Fe reconstructed without correction of the self-absorption effect was 9.26 % of the actual density. Using this correction method, 73.0 % of the actual density could be obtained.

paper_title.en: Hard X-Ray Fourier Transform Holography with Zone Plates
paper_title.ja: Hard X-Ray Fourier Transform Holography with Zone Plates

description.en: Using two zone plates, a hard x-ray lens-less Fourier transform holographic microscope with cone-beam illumination was investigated at SPring-8 BL20XU. One zone plate was placed on the optical axis, and another zone plate was placed 16 mm downstream and 9 mum off the optical axis. The diverging x-rays from the focus of the upstream zone plate illuminated a specimen where the focus of the downstream zone plate was placed. A hologram of a copper mesh of 12.7 mum pitch could be obtained. The intensity and the phase could be successfully reconstructed with sub-micron resolution.

presentation_title.ja: ゾーンプレートX線顕微鏡を用いたシュリーレン像からの位相トモグラフィー
presentation_title.en: X-ray Phase Tomography Using Schlieren Images of Zone-Plate X-ray Microscope

event.ja: Optics & Photonics Japan 2023

description.ja: 放射光PF-BL3CにおけるゾーンプレートX線顕微鏡を用いた位相トモグラフィーについて報告する。試料を0～360度回転させて撮影したシュリーレン像から計算した0～180度の微分位相像を用いて位相トモグラフィーを行った。5.4 keVにおける沖縄軽石の観察例を報告する。
description.en: An x-ray microscope with a zone plate and a schlieren knife-edge has developed at the Photon Factory BL3C. Using this microscope, relatively quantitative phase tomography is possible by recording Schlieren images while rotating the sample 360 degrees. We report on the results of X-ray phase tomography observation of pumice collected in Okinawa.

presentation_title.ja: シュリーレン像によるX線位相トモグラフィー
presentation_title.en: X-ray Phase Tomography Using Schlieren Images

event.ja: 第36回日本放射光学会年会・放射光科学合同シンポジウム

location.ja: 立命館大学 びわこ・くさつキャンパス

description.ja: フーコーナイフエッジをゾーンプレート後焦点に置くことにより、シュリーレン像が得られる。互いに逆向きにエッジを置いて撮影した2枚の像から、定量的な微分位相像が得られる。位相CTにおいては試料を360度回転して互いに180度異なった2枚の画像から微分位相像を計算することにより、エッジを固定したシュリーレン像から位相CTが可能であることがわかった。
description.en: フーコーナイフエッジをゾーンプレート後焦点に置くことにより、シュリーレン像が得られる。互いに逆向きにエッジを置いて撮影した2枚の像から、定量的な微分位相像が得られる。位相CTにおいては試料を360度回転して互いに180度異なった2枚の画像から微分位相像を計算することにより、エッジを固定したシュリーレン像から位相CTが可能であることがわかった。

presentation_title.ja: Development of Soft X-ray Spectro-Microscope with Wolter mirror
presentation_title.en: Development of Soft X-ray Spectro-Microscope with Wolter mirror

event.ja: 15th International Conference on X-ray Microscopy

description.ja: A Wolter mirror is an optical element that uses total external reflection and has no chromatic aberration. In a Wolter mirror imaging system, the magnification does not change even if the soft X-ray energy is changed, so it is possible to easily compare changes in the image when the energy is changed. Therefore, it is an optimum optical element for a full-field spectroscopic microscope. Since a Wolter mirror has a ring aperture, it is necessary to adjust the NA so that the illumination light enters the mirror ring. In this study, a plane mirror was used to illuminate a sample at the angle of the average NA. The imaging performance was evaluated in a wide energy range from 100 eV to 900 eV at the Photon Factory BL11D.
description.en: A Wolter mirror is an optical element that uses total external reflection and has no chromatic aberration. In a Wolter mirror imaging system, the magnification does not change even if the soft X-ray energy is changed, so it is possible to easily compare changes in the image when the energy is changed. Therefore, it is an optimum optical element for a full-field spectroscopic microscope. Since a Wolter mirror has a ring aperture, it is necessary to adjust the NA so that the illumination light enters the mirror ring. In this study, a plane mirror was used to illuminate a sample at the angle of the average NA. The imaging performance was evaluated in a wide energy range from 100 eV to 900 eV at the Photon Factory BL11D.

presentation_title.ja: X-ray Differential Phase-Contrast Imaging Using Schlieren knife-edge and Diffuser Plate
presentation_title.en: X-ray Differential Phase-Contrast Imaging Using Schlieren knife-edge and Diffuser Plate

event.ja: 15th International Conference on X-ray Microscopy

description.ja: We have been developing an x-ray differential phase microscope and micro-tomography by introducing an edge scanning filter into the back focal point of the objective zone plate. In this method, a relatively quantitative differential phase image can be obtained by scanning the edge at the back focal position by several microns during exposure. However, the problem was that the deviation of the edge position greatly affected the differential phase image. Therefore, differential phase imaging with a fixed Schlieren edge was tested by expanding the incident X-rays with a diffuser to the extent corresponding to the scanning width. Using a diffuser plate of rotating an abrasive paper, the same effect as scanning the edges was observed in the differential phase image. A sample such as polystyrene beads could be reconstructed with almost uniform value in phase tomography.
description.en: We have been developing an x-ray differential phase microscope and micro-tomography by introducing an edge scanning filter into the back focal point of the objective zone plate. In this method, a relatively quantitative differential phase image can be obtained by scanning the edge at the back focal position by several microns during exposure. However, the problem was that the deviation of the edge position greatly affected the differential phase image. Therefore, differential phase imaging with a fixed Schlieren edge was tested by expanding the incident X-rays with a diffuser to the extent corresponding to the scanning width. Using a diffuser plate of rotating an abrasive paper, the same effect as scanning the edges was observed in the differential phase image. A sample such as polystyrene beads could be reconstructed with almost uniform value in phase tomography.

presentation_title.ja: フーコーナイフエッジを用いた X線顕微鏡による位相トモグラフィー
presentation_title.en: X-ray Phase Tomography Using X-ray Microscope with Foucault Knife Edge

event.ja: 第69回応用物理学会春季学術講演会

description.ja: ゾーンプレート後焦点にフーコーナイフエッジを置いた微分位相コントラストX線顕微鏡を放射光Photon Factory BL3Cに構築し、位相トモグラフィー実験を5.4 keVで行った。これまで互いに逆方向にナイフエッジを置いて撮影した2枚の像から微分位相像を計算していたが、互いに180度試料の角度の異なる2枚のシュリーレン像を用いることで、固定したエッジでも位相CT再構成が可能であることを示した。
description.en: A differential phase-contrast X-ray microscope with a Foucault knife edge at the back focal point of the zone plate objective was assembled at the Photon Factory BL3C, and a phase tomography experiment was performed at 5.4 keV. Previously, a differential phase image was calculated from two images taken with knife edges placed in opposite directions. By using two Schlieren images of a sample with different angles of 180 degree, it was shown that phase CT reconstruction is possible with the fixed knife edge.

presentation_title.ja: ゾーンプレートとフーコーナイフエッジを用いたX線微分位相結像と位相CT
presentation_title.en: X-ray Differential Phase-Contrast Imaging and Phase CT Using a Zone Plate and a Foucault Knife-Edge

event.ja: 日本光学会年次学術講演会

description.ja: Illuminating a sample with parallel x-rays and scanning a knife-edge at the back focal plane of an objective zone plate, a relatively quantitative differential phase image can be obtained. If a light source having a focal point spread at the back focal plane of the zone plate is used, the same effect can be expected without scanning the knife-edge. In this study, a diffuser was introduced into the illumination system to extend the focal spot, and the phase CT image of polystyrene beads could be obtained.
description.en: Illuminating a sample with parallel x-rays and scanning a knife-edge at the back focal plane of an objective zone plate, a relatively quantitative differential phase image can be obtained. If a light source having a focal point spread at the back focal plane of the zone plate is used, the same effect can be expected without scanning the knife-edge. In this study, a diffuser was introduced into the illumination system to extend the focal spot, and the phase CT image of polystyrene beads could be obtained.

presentation_title.ja: Photon FactoryにおけるWolterミラー軟X線顕微鏡の開発
presentation_title.en: Development of soft X-ray microscope with a Wolter mirror at Photon Factory BL11D

event.ja: 第68回応用物理学会春季学術講演会

description.ja: Wolterミラーを用いた結像型軟X線顕微鏡をPhoton Factory BL11Dに構築し、60 - 900 eVで結像テストを行った。試料の透過像をWolterミラーで倍率19倍に拡大し、CCDカメラで撮像した。ダイヤモンド粉末をテストサンプルとして用い、900 eVまで分光イメージングを行うことが可能であった。
description.en: A full-field soft X-ray microscope using a Wolter mirror was assembled at the Photon Factory BL11D, and imaging tests were performed at 60-900 eV. Transmitted images of a sample were magnified 19 times by a Wolter mirror and recorded by a CCD camera. It was possible to perform spectroscopic imaging of diamond powder up to 900 eV.

location.en: 日本 愛知県名古屋市

description.ja: 我々は、X線顕微鏡の対物ゾーンプレート後焦点にエッジ走査フィルターを導入することによって微分位相像を取得し、位相CTへの応用を行ってきた。露光中に後焦点位置でエッジを走査することで比較的定量的な微分位相像が得られるが、エッジ位置のずれが微分位相像に大きく影響することが問題であった。そこで、入射X線を拡散板で広げておくことで、固定したエッジを用いたシュリーレン像でもエッジを走査した場合と同様の効果が得られるかどうか実験を行った。。拡散板を用いた場合、微分像ではエッジを走査した場合と同様な効果が観察され、位相CTでもポリスチレンがほぼ均一な値で再構成できた。
description.en: 我々は、X線顕微鏡の対物ゾーンプレート後焦点にエッジ走査フィルターを導入することによって微分位相像を取得し、位相CTへの応用を行ってきた。露光中に後焦点位置でエッジを走査することで比較的定量的な微分位相像が得られるが、エッジ位置のずれが微分位相像に大きく影響することが問題であった。そこで、入射X線を拡散板で広げておくことで、固定したエッジを用いたシュリーレン像でもエッジを走査した場合と同様の効果が得られるかどうか実験を行った。。拡散板を用いた場合、微分像ではエッジを走査した場合と同様な効果が観察され、位相CTでもポリスチレンがほぼ均一な値で再構成できた。

presentation_title.ja: X-ray Differential Phase Imaging using Foucault knife-edge and Diffuser plate
presentation_title.en: X-ray Differential Phase Imaging using Foucault knife-edge and Diffuser plate

event.ja: The 15th Symposium of Japanese Research Community on X-ray Imaging Optics (XIO2019)
event.en: The 15th Symposium of Japanese Research Community on X-ray Imaging Optics (XIO2019)

description.ja: We have been developing an x-ray differential phase microscope at the beam line BL3C of the Photon Factory, Japan. By combining a zone plate x-ray microscope and a scanning knife-edge filter at the back focal plane of a zone plate, a relatively quantitative phase image of x-rays can be obtained. This method needs to scan the knife-edge accurately within a range of one micron during exposure. The positioning accuracy has become a problem especially when many projection images such as tomography are obtained continuously. Therefore, we examined whether the same result as edge scanning could be obtained by slightly shaking the illumination x-rays with a diffuser. A phase tomography test was performed at 7.0 keV using a sample of the stone meteorite NWA869 cut to a size of several tens of microns. The relatively good reconstruction image could be obtained by using the diffuser without scanning the filter edge.
description.en: We have been developing an x-ray differential phase microscope at the beam line BL3C of the Photon Factory, Japan. By combining a zone plate x-ray microscope and a scanning knife-edge filter at the back focal plane of a zone plate, a relatively quantitative phase image of x-rays can be obtained. This method needs to scan the knife-edge accurately within a range of one micron during exposure. The positioning accuracy has become a problem especially when many projection images such as tomography are obtained continuously. Therefore, we examined whether the same result as edge scanning could be obtained by slightly shaking the illumination x-rays with a diffuser. A phase tomography test was performed at 7.0 keV using a sample of the stone meteorite NWA869 cut to a size of several tens of microns. The relatively good reconstruction image could be obtained by using the diffuser without scanning the filter edge.

presentation_title.ja: Rigorous analysis of reflection spectrum of absorbing film
presentation_title.en: Rigorous analysis of reflection spectrum of absorbing film

presentation_title.ja: フーコーナイフエッジと拡散板を用いたX線微分位相結像
presentation_title.en: X-ray Differential Phase Imaging using Foucault knife edge and Diffuser plate

presenters_text.ja: 渡辺, 紀生;青木貞雄
presenters_text.en: 渡辺, 紀生;青木貞雄

event.ja: 応用物理学会春季学術講演会

description.ja: ゾーンプレートＸ線顕微鏡において、ゾーンプレート後焦点位置で露光中にナイフエッジを走査することで、微分位相像を得ることができる。本研究では、拡散板によって入射Ｘ線をわずかに振ることで、エッジを固定してもエッジ走査と同様の効果が得られないか検討を行った。7keVでの結像実験では、エッジを固定して拡散板を挿入すると、拡散板が無いときと比較してわずかに微分位相像のコントラストが変化することが観察できた。
description.en: Using a zone plate X-ray microscope, a differential phase image can be obtained by scanning a knife edge at the back focal point of the zone plate during exposure. In this study, we investigated whether the same effects as the edge scanning can be obtained by using a fixed edge and incident x-rays slightly diffused by a diffuser at 7 keV. By inserting the diffuser and the fixed edge, a slightly change in contrast of a differential phase image could be observed compared with the image obtained by using only the fixed edge.

presentation_title.ja: 3D observation of quasicrystal alloy using X-ray differential phase-contrast microscope with a zone plate
presentation_title.en: 3D observation of quasicrystal alloy using X-ray differential phase-contrast microscope with a zone plate
